subsection.name: Overview
subsection.p: This type of rule will present you with three input fiels and a couple of checkboxes, namely:
subsection.pre: - Description - Conditions - From - To - Case Sensitive - Type - Use Wildcard Matching - Process other rules

subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: This field is meant to provide a clear description of the rule, so it's clear for other people what it does and why it was created. This will also help you to find it later using the search.

subsection.name: Conditions
subsection.p: These conditions must match for this rule to be processed, click here for the documentation.

subsection.name: From
subsection.p: Here you can enter the URL that must be rewritten as a regular expression.

subsection.name: To
subsection.p: This field takes the URL where the above URL should be rewritten to. It can contain backreferences, variables and functions.

tr.td: Provides access to the grouped parts (parentheses) of the pattern from the 'From' field.
Provides access to the grouped parts (parentheses) of the pattern from the last matched Condition in the current rule.
Will return either http or https. Any valid condition type can be used as a variable name.
my dog is a blue dog
my dog is a blue cat

subsection.name: Case Sensitive
subsection.p: Tick this checkbox to take the case of the URL that is matched into account.

subsection.name: Type
subsection.p: What type of redirect should take place.

tr.td: Requests matching the "conditions" for this "rule", and the URL in the "from" element will be internally forwarded to the URL specified in the "to" element.
Requests matching the "conditions" and the "from" for this rule will be HTTP redirected
The request will be proxied to the full url specified

subsection.name: Use Wildcard Matching
subsection.p: Use wildcard matching instead of regular expressions. A single wildcard (*) will match any single element, ** will match all elements.

subsection.name: Process other rules
subsection.p: Other rules will be processed after this one succeeds, same as the 'last' flag of Apache's mod_rewrite.
